name: Rista
description: Rista is a spicy meatball dish made with lamb, tomatoes, spices, and onions. It is popular in the state of Jammu and Kashmir.

name: Rogan Josh
description: Rogan Josh is an aromatic lamb dish with flavors of browned onions, various spices and yoghurt. It is usually served with steamed rice and consists of pieces of lamb or mutton braised with gravy flavored with garlic, ginger and aromatic spices (cloves, bay leaves, cardamom, and cinnamon).

name: Laal Maas
description: Laal Maas is a spicy Indian dish made with lamb and a variety of spices, including red chili powder. It is popular in the state of Rajasthan.

name: Daal Bati
description: Daal Bati is a traditional dish from Rajasthan that is made with a combination of lentils and baatis, which are hard, round, and crunchy wheat balls. The dish is usually served with ghee and various spice blends, making it a popular and flavorful staple of the Rajasthani cuisine.

name: Butter Chicken
description: Butter Chicken is a mild and creamy Indian dish made with chicken, tomatoes, butter, and a variety of spices. It is popular in the state of Punjab.

name: Sadya
description: Sadya is a traditional vegetarian feast from the state of Kerala, consisting of rice and a variety of dishes made with coconut and spices.

name: Andhra Chicken Curry
description: Andhra Chicken Curry is a spicy and flavorful dish made with chicken, onions, tomatoes, spices, and curry leaves. It is popular in the state of Andhra Pradesh.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: Hyderabadi Biryani is a variation of the classic biryani dish, made with aromatic rice and juicy, spiced meat. It is popular in the state of Telangana.

name: Thukpa
description: Thukpa is a traditional Tibetan noodle soup that is popular in the state of Arunachal Pradesh. It can be made with either vegetables or meat and is a warm and comforting dish.

name: Masor Tenga
description: Masor Tenga is a traditional fish curry from the northeastern state of Assam in India. 'Masor' means fish, and 'Tenga' means sour, which refers to the sourness that comes from the use of ingredients like tomatoes, elephant apple, and dried kokum fruit. The dish is made with a variety of fish, including catfish, rohu, and hilsa, and is cooked in a tangy, spicy tomato and vegetable-based gravy. It is typically served with steamed rice, and sometimes with side dishes like pickles or fried vegetables. Masor Tenga is a popular dish in Assam because it is a staple of the region's cuisine and is enjoyed by people of all ages. The use of sour ingredients like elephant apple and kokum gives the dish a unique flavor that is characteristic of Assamese cuisine. Additionally, it is a healthy dish, as it is low in fat and high in protein. It is also easy to prepare, making it a favorite among busy households.

name: Litti Chokha
description: Litti Chokha is a popular dish in the state of Bihar that is made with whole wheat flour, sattu flour, spices, ghee, and potatoes. It is typically served with a side of spicy mashed potatoes.

name: Bafauri
description: Bafauri is a popular dish in the state of Chhattisgarh that is made with chana dal, rice flour, spices, ghee, and onions. It is a staple food in the region and is typically served with a side of chutney.

name: Vindaloo
description: Vindaloo is a popular dish in the state of Goa that is made with pork, vinegar, chilies, spices, and garlic. It is a staple food in the region and is known for its fiery flavor.

name: Dhokla
description: Dhokla is a popular Indian snack food made from fermented batter of chickpea flour. It is steamed and served with a variety of chutneys.
where_to_eat: Gujarati restaurants and street food stalls

name: Chhole Bhature
description: Chole Bhature is a popular dish in Haryana and other northern states of India. It consists of spicy chickpeas served with deep-fried bread called Bhature.
where_to_eat: Haryanvi restaurants and street food stalls

name: Madra
description: Madra is a traditional Himachali dish made from yogurt and gram flour. It is flavored with spices and served with rice or roti.

name: Dhuska
description: Dhuska is a popular dish in Jharkhand, originating from the Santhal tribe. It is made from rice flour and is deep-fried until crispy. It is often served with chutney or curry.
where_to_eat: Jharkhandi restaurants and street food stalls

name: Mysore Masala Dosa
description: Mysore Masala Dosa is a popular dish in Karnataka, originating from the city of Mysore. It is a type of dosa (rice flour crepe) filled with a spicy potato filling and served with chutney and sambar.
where_to_eat: Karnatakan restaurants and street food stalls

name: Poha
description: Poha is a popular dish in Madhya Pradesh and is typically served for breakfast. It is made from flattened rice and is flavored with spices, peanuts, and vegetables.
where_to_eat: Madhya Pradesh restaurants and street food stalls

name: Idli
description: Idli is a staple food in Tamil Nadu and is widely considered as one of the healthiest breakfast options. It is made from a fermented batter of rice and urad dal and is steamed to form light and fluffy cakes.
where_to_eat: Tamil Nadu restaurants and street food stalls

name: Vada Pav
description: Vada Pav is a popular street food in Maharashtra and is often referred to as the Indian burger. It consists of a bread roll stuffed with a potato fritter and various spices and chutneys.

name: Eromba
description: Eromba is a popular dish in Manipur and is typically served as a main course. It is made from a mixture of vegetables, rice flour, and spices, and is often served with chutney.
